mishap.hexweb.invalid_json_key: The "%s" key is not present within the JsonIota!
mishap.hexweb.cannot_json: The %s iota has no direct Json translation!
mishap.hexweb.too_early: You tried accessing a HTTP response before it arrived!
hexweb.page.json_patterns.entry: These patterns were taken from a series of notes scrawled on the walls of the room of a Dougles Crockford shortly before their disappearence.$(br)$(br)They describe ways of creating and manipulating a dictionary-like object which uses Strings for keys and a select range of iotas as values. I wonder what the practical applications are...
hexweb.page.json_patterns.has_element: Checks whether the given JSON iota has the given key.
hexweb.page.json_patterns.get_element: Gets the stored iota at the given key. Mishaps upon their being no iota.
hexweb.page.json_patterns.set_element: Sets the given iota at the given key. Setting a Garbage iota removes the key.
hexweb.page.http_spells.entry: While pondering the depths of one's mind, Sir Bernes-Lee caught a glimpse into another universe. With this view fresh in his mind, he quickly conjured a JSON object, imbued it with information, and sent it hurdling into the other universe.$(br)$(br)These are the patterns recovered after Berners-Lee was found dead having recieved enough information back to fry his mind.
hexweb.page.http_spells.request: Sends an HTTP request made of the given data and method to the provided connection's endpoint.
hexweb.page.http_spells.parse_response: Given a Response, attempt to parse the results. Will Mishap if too early or an IOException is thrown.
hexweb.page.connection_patterns.entry: Have you ever gotten to a point where, when searching for something, after checking the most obvious places, you then start searching the most obscure, random places you can find.$(br)$(br)These patterns are the epitome of that. A search for parallel universes and the rips in the seams of Nature's domain. A guestimate if you will of where a rip will be.
hexweb.page.connection_patterns.create_c: Creates a new Connection given the four quartets of an IPv4 address and a port.
Creates a new Connection given an address as a string and a port.
Creates a new Connection which points to ones own universe (127.0.0.1:80).
hexweb.page.connection_patterns.get_conn: Breaks a Connection down into its address as a string and its port.
Breaks a Connection down into its address as its four quartets and its port.
hexweb.page.connection_patterns.set_host: Changes a Connection's address to one made of the four provided quartets.
Changes a Connection's address to the provided string.
